mads.note: Brill's New Pauly new equates this author with Phaedimus Elegist (tlg1577)
TLG Canon of Greek Authors and Works, Third Edition, pg. 300

Smith's Dictionary of Greek and Roman Biography and Mythology, Vol 3, 1867, p. 230: "Phaedimus, 3, an epigrammatic poet, four of whose epigrams are contained in the Greek Anthology.... We learn from Stephanus that he was a native of Bisanthe in Macedonia...He also perhaps wrote an epic poem entitled Heracleia"

Brill's New Pauly: "Phaedimus, Elegist, from Bisanthe in Thrace or, according to others, from Amastri ....also composed epigrams; four are preserved in the Anthologia Palatina...Author of a Ἡρακλεία ( Hērakleía ) of which Ath. 11,498e cites one hexameter ...""Di Marco, Massimo (Fondi Latina). "Phaedimus." Brill's New Pauly. Antiquity volumes edited by: Hubert Cancik and Helmuth Schneider . Brill, 2009. Brill Online.
